subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Clint Bowyer outraced Kasey Kahne and the rain to win the Nationwide Series race at Bristol Motor Speedway when it was stopped just past the halfway point.“It feels awesome,” Bowyer said Saturday after a lengthy stoppage in Bristol, Tenn. “I’ll take it any way you can get it.”Rain delayed the start of the race by two hours. When it finally started, the drivers knew they were running against the weather. Bowyer’s car was one of a handful not to pit when Mike Bliss spun to bring out the sixth caution 100 laps into the race. Knowing the race needed to go only another 51 laps to be considered official, Bowyer gambled that the cars who were not pitted would be unable to catch him before the rain came.
